meanings.definition: A song or poem of praise or glorification.
meanings.sent1: The students sang an odea to their teacher during the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The poet composed a beautiful odea to honor the fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The odea praising the new ice cream flavor was so catchy that everyone started singing along.
meanings.sent4: Her odea to nature painted vivid pictures of blooming flowers and chirping birds.
meanings.sent5: The grand finale of the concert was an odea that left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: A formal and elaborate lyric poem, often in the form of an address or meditation.
meanings.sent1: The odea written for the wedding ceremony was filled with heartfelt emotions.
meanings.sent2: During the poetry recital, she performed an odea that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The odea about a lost sock was both amusing and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent4: His odea to the night sky compared stars to twinkling diamonds in a vast black sea.
meanings.sent5: The odea recited by the young poet was so moving that it brought tears to many eyes.

meanings.definition: A classical Greek or Roman lyric poem, typically with a triadic structure.
meanings.sent1: In her literature class, she analyzed the structure of a famous odea from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent2: The library displayed an ancient manuscript containing a well-preserved odea.
meanings.sent3: The odea about a mischievous cat was a fun twist on the traditional form.
meanings.sent4: His odea to friendship compared it to a sturdy bridge connecting hearts.
meanings.sent5: The odea recited at the poetry competition was a powerful tribute to the classics.
